channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: How the Minneapolis killings look from Trump country
item.description: The shooting of Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good by federal agents in Minneapolis have enraged many people across the country. NPR wanted to know what supporters of President Trump's immigration policy think about the shootings.
item.content:encoded:
The shooting of Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good by federal agents in Minneapolis have enraged many people across the country. NPR wanted to know what supporters of President Trump's immigration policy think about the shootings.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: U.S. life expectancy hits a new high, as deaths from overdoses and COVID fall
item.description: An American born in 2024 can expect to live to be 79, on average. But people in other wealthy countries can expect to live longer.
item.content:encoded:
An American born in 2024 can expect to live to be 79, on average. But people in other wealthy countries can expect to live longer.

(Image credit: FG Trade)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Tesla profits slumped 46% last year, as it lost its crown as the top EV seller
item.description: The company announced it was ending production of its higher-end Model S and Model Y, and turning that production space over to making humanoid robots.
item.content:encoded:
The company announced it was ending production of its higher-end Model S and Model Y, and turning that production space over to making humanoid robots.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: For first-time Grammy nominee Michael Mayo, vocal expression is innate
item.description: Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly, with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his career.
item.content:encoded:
Fly, earned the jazz vocalist his first Grammy nominations of his career.'/>

Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly, with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his career.

(Image credit: Lauren Desberg)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: The FBI conducts a search at the Fulton County election office in Georgia
item.description: The FBI would not clarify whether the action is tied to the 2020 election, but last month the Department of Justice announced it's suing Fulton County for records related to the election.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI would not clarify whether the action is tied to the 2020 election, but last month the Department of Justice announced it's suing Fulton County for records related to the election.

(Image credit: John Bazemore)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Bruce Springsteen releases anti-ICE protest song 'Streets of Minneapolis'
item.description: On Wednesday, Bruce Springsteen released 'Streets of Minneapolis,' a protest song condemning the violence of Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded:
On Wednesday, Bruce Springsteen released 'Streets of Minneapolis,' a protest song condemning the violence of Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents in Minneapolis.

(Image credit: Mondadori Portfolio/Mondadori Portfolio via Getty Im)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: Fed holds interest rates steady, taking a pause from rate cuts to assess the economy
item.description: The central bank cut rates at its three previous meetings in an effort to support the job market. But with inflation still elevated, the Fed is cautious about additional rate cuts.
item.content:encoded:
The central bank cut rates at its three previous meetings in an effort to support the job market. But with inflation still elevated, the Fed is cautious about additional rate cuts.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Trump's National Guard deployments could cost over $1 billion this year, CBO projects
item.description: The operation in Washington, D.C. alone is projected to cost upwards of $660 million if it runs through the end of this year as expected, according to new data released by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.
item.content:encoded:
The operation in Washington, D.C. alone is projected to cost upwards of $660 million if it runs through the end of this year as expected, according to new data released by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Here's what to know about the $50 billion states are getting for rural health
item.description: To satisfy Republicans opposed to last summer's cuts to health care, the Trump administration launched an ambitious 5-year initiative known as the Rural Health Transformation Program.
item.content:encoded:
To satisfy Republicans opposed to last summer's cuts to health care, the Trump administration launched an ambitious 5-year initiative known as the Rural Health Transformation Program.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Levi

item.title: Greetings from Mumbai, where residents take breathing space where they can find it
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid
